layer.name: Causality
layer.definition: Actions have consequences; you reap what you sow.

questions.text: My emotional patterns are influenced by what I consistently think, believe, and practice ...
questions.principle: Emotions respond to cognitive and behavioral inputs

answers.4: mostly — there's a clear link between inputs and emotional patterns
answers.5: directly — what I feed grows; what I starve fades
answers.2: possibly — but it's hard to see the connection
answers.3: somewhat — some emotions connect to inputs, others seem random
answers.1: not really — emotions just happen to me

questions.text: When I have a strong emotional response, I can usually identify the trigger ...

answers.4: usually — I can trace most reactions to something
answers.5: almost always — emotions don't just happen; they're triggered
answers.2: sometimes — but often I have no idea
answers.3: about half the time — some are clear, some aren't

questions.text: Emotionally healthy people built that health through specific practices ...
questions.principle: Emotional health is cultivated, not inherited

answers.4: mostly — emotional health is cultivated over time
answers.5: definitely — emotional health is built, not born
answers.2: possibly — but temperament seems more important
answers.3: partially — practice helps, but some have it easier
answers.1: not necessarily — some people are just naturally stable

questions.text: Chronic emotional struggles usually have root causes that can be identified ...
questions.principle: Chronic emotional patterns have root causes

answers.4: usually — there are identifiable factors feeding chronic patterns
answers.5: almost always — emotional patterns have causal roots
answers.2: possibly — but causes are often mysterious
answers.3: sometimes — some struggles have clear roots, others don't
answers.1: not really — anxiety and depression just happen

questions.text: The connection between how I treat body, mind, and spirit and my emotional state is ...
questions.principle: Emotional state connects to holistic health

answers.4: strong — neglect in one area shows up emotionally
answers.5: direct — body, mind, spirit, and emotions are deeply interconnected
answers.3: partial — some areas affect emotions, others don't seem to
answers.1: weak — emotions are separate from physical/mental/spiritual health

remediation.advice: Emotions are signals, not random noise. When you feel something strong, ask: 'What am I believing right now? What just happened? What pattern is this part of?' The cause is there if you look for it.

scripture.text: Be angry and do not sin; do not let the sun go down on your anger.
